item.title: Graphs and Networks in Mathematics
item.description: Definitions 1 A set comprising vertices and lines connecting vertices is called a graph or a network. Let’s denote the set of vertices as $V$ and the set of lines as $E$. Elements of $V(G) := V$ are called vertices or nodes of $G$. Elements of $E(G) := E$ are called edges or links of $G$. An edge that connects to the same vertex is called a loop. If two
